text: Erigeron eximius is a North American species of flowering plants in the daisy family known by the common name spruce-fir fleabane. Erigeron eximius is native to the western United States. It is found in alpine meadows and in openings in aspen and spruce/fir forests in Wyoming, Colorado, Utah, Arizona, New Mexico, and western Texas.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Erigeron eximius is a perennial herb up to 60 centimeters (2 feet) in height, spreading by means of underground rhizomes. Each stem can produce 1-15 flower heads, each with as many as 80 blue or lavender ray florets surrounding numerous yellow disc florets.Flora of North America, Erigeron eximius Greene, Spruce-fir fleabane ==References== eximius Category:Flora of the Western United States Category:Plants described in 1898
